title: LiveEdutvICO
author: LiveEdutvICO
content: The gaming industry has arguably been the most forward-thinking one when it comes to embracing new technology. According to Education Ecosystem, a financial layer in gaming is inevitable as the internet gradually develops into a superpower economy. Utilize Web3 by visiting educationecosystem.com"

comments.author: livingfree
comments.body: You don't have to put that into bold and have those texts with huge font size.Quote from: LiveEdutvICO on September 28, 2022, 01:06:37 PMThe gaming industry has arguably been the most forward-thinking one when it comes to embracing new technology. According to Education Ecosystem, a financial layer in gaming is inevitable as the internet gradually develops into a superpower economy. It's because there's already a foundation set in gaming, whether it's for Web3, NFT/P2E games, there has been a huge community that's already there.And these projects just have to make the most of it and connect it to the passionate gamers worldwide with what they have to offer.It's true that a financial layer could be just another big upgrade to it and many will likely to adopt it as it'll make purchasing and gaming easier. Although, it's already easy now but there could be a better thing about it and web3.

comments.author: Helena Simmons
comments.body: Gaming economies are already in play with the current crop of Web2 games. Several examples exist, including World of Warcraft’s Gold and Second Life’s Linden Dollars. However, they have little usability outside their respective in-game ecosystems. Yet, if the gaming industry fully embraced Web3 and blockchain technologies, a new world of GameFi and Play-to-Earn (P2E) could be unlocked.GameFi and P2E (play-to-earn) are concepts within the Web3 gaming space that allow players to earn cryptocurrency through playing games including GameInfinity, Axie Infinity, Gala games

comments.author: Stephanpomp
comments.body: In traditional gaming, players own in-game assets and collectibles, but they lose all of their assets once they can lose it. Web3 gaming solves this by providing true ownership and interoperability. Under Web3, users could potentially own and monetize their own data, or receive payment for contributing to the platform. And, if you stop playing, you can sell or trade your assets and kick-off.

comments.author: kelonmusk
comments.body: I think the statement about the gaming industry embracing new technology is absolutely true. So, integrating Web3 technology could create new revenue streams for game developers. For example, they could create in-game currencies that players could purchase with cryptocurrency, further incentivizing players to engage with their games.By implementing blockchain technology, players could have ownership over their in-game assets and trade them freely without having to go through centralized platforms. I means, this would give players more control and flexibility over their gaming experiences. I think web3 has the potential to be a major force in the future of game and blockchain industries.
